I've been playing since launch and I've been excitedly waiting for this Steam page to pop up because I knew the reviews were going to be absolutely devastating, deservedly so. This game has made it increasingly apparent how out of touch Blizzard is with both it's fan-base, game design, and story design. 

For those last two points, I'd like to refer to both the botched handling of it's PvE situation. 
I'm sure it's been said to death about the disappointment players had when they nixed hero progression. 
But the thing is, that core mechanic was the ONE 'reward' aspect in PvE. Blizzard doesn't do story-lines well; their storytelling method, as it's been since the Warcraft days, is "Dude/Dudes/Dudettes go here, they fight, say some one-liners, and leave." The fact that the lore, the characters, the storyline and the main villain in the game have changed about 5 times is proof that they don't know what they're doing, and therefore "story" won't be enough to carry the PvE on it's own. 

But, without hero progression and therefore no reward, what does that make the PvE mode? A mind-numbing arena where you're shooting bulletsponges that don't react outside of having their crit spots destroyed, which just makes them more fucking bullet sponge. The freebie, Underworld, starts off with a 10 minute segment where you stand there and shoot bots as either Lucio, Winston, Torb or Tracer. 4 characters who have been in game since launch. (Which, makes the "We can't do hero progression" claim all the more doubtful. That's 4 characters.) Call of Duty Zombies was successful because it progressively got more difficult and would reward you with special pickups and new weapons; Rainbow Six Extraction worked as a PvE alternative because there was a natural progression to the game and ironically, their characters had hero progression. Here, you're just playing with the same kits you always have, shooting at bots like it's a mildly more engaging practice range. 

In other words, the PvE is fucking boring. Also, their attempts at the MCU jokes and charms with their inconsistent background characters makes me physically cringe. At least try to make the character a knowable entity first without me having to go down a Wiki and web comic fucking rabbit hole before you try making them hit us with the jokes.

Now, what about the PvP? Well, it's fun... for the first two weeks every time a new game mode, map or game release comes out. I was actually having fun playing Flashpoint, but like when Overwatch 1 came out, like when Overwatch 2 came out, like when Push came out, I know that this fun is only going to last a short while, before the toxicity of this games community gets it's sweaty mittens all over it and it returns to being a joyless, miserable experience where any slight misstep leads into a Zarya or Genji main jumping down your throat. That's right, you can't learn the rock paper scissors in this game without someone being mad you didn't know the enemy team had the scissors to your paper. This game has such a horribly toxic community, I stopped playing online games because of them. Playing video games should be fun, not anxiety-inducing. 

Perhaps it's the 90's nostalgia in me, but I miss the days of couch multiplayer, or even early Xbox Live, when you were just shooting shit with your friends or even randoms and having a blast with them. Nowadays, these games are more dedicated to seeing who could topkek teabag git guud whatever the fuck and make you play for 4000 hours. Playing this game with friends manages to even be miserable; either they end up being below or above your skill level, so you're either the anchor or being anchored, leading to relentless team wipe games that go one way or the other. 

But if there's balancing like that, that's gotta mean you get good games solo queueing, right? 
No. 

It's genuinely SO rare I found a match where it felt like both teams gave their all and had a decent fight. 99 times out of 100 it's just counterpicking until the timer runs out, so it doesn't feel like you won, but rather you just managed to choose the right character at the right time. 

Oh, I forgot to mention the sexual harrassment lawsuit, their employee who committed suicide over harrassment, the fact that they lied to us about hero progression existing for 1.5 years after they knew they were canceling it (Before Overwatch 2 had actually been out, btw.) or the fact that they used that as a selling point for the game when they were actually just sneaking in a metric fuckton of monetization schemes for things you could previously earn for free.

Fuck this game fucking sucks. Fuck Blizzard.

守望先锋压测的时候，舍友在玩，接手玩过几局，只玩76，不太有感觉，觉得不过如此，但是不知道什么原因，一直让我忘不了，然后开服后两个舍友一直在玩，中间也找隔壁宿舍老马借号和舍友一起玩，那时候其实已经想买了，但是能借到号也没不觉得到值得花钱的地步。
2016/05/24开服，之后两周，舍友在玩我偶尔也借号凑凑热闹，各种套路打得稀烂也是欢声笑语。
2016/06/10的晚上，那是一个周六，大学附近的网吧在周末的晚上想弄几个连座可不容易，背靠背的几个座位凑成了伪连座，看着舍友和老马在玩，然偶没有别的号能借到的时候，我没有多少纠结就选择了下单购买，就此开启了守望先锋的游戏之旅。
此后六年，从北到南，从宿舍到旅行到回家到工作，都有守望先锋还有当中的好多小伙伴的陪伴，在七八个城市都留下了打守望先锋的记忆。从借号游玩到2022/10/04的3167级，再到2023/01/23的国服的关闭，这一切都令人唏嘘，游戏停服这种事其实早就经历过了，2015年，玩了五年的QQ家园宣布下线，玩了四五年的游戏（阳光牧场，精武堂，纵横四海，餐厅，哦还有个种花的现在连名字都忘记了）一切都灰飞烟灭，只有一点点别的游戏的补偿，那时候就知道，没有什么游戏是永久的，除非能一直盈利，或许现在条件不仅仅只是盈利了，可能是要变成一直比别人盈利得多才能生存吧。暴雪和网易的分家，也不过是利益之争，谈得拢就合谈不拢就分，也很正常，只是真的没想到这么突然罢了，数据的留存，也不知道是网易不给暴雪还是受限于不能说的不能给，或是说两家之间还有什么交易纠葛不清给不出，这就是我们玩家不得而知的了，而我给游戏打差评的理由，也不过是缅怀青春加上确实想要回大陆服务器的数据而已，至于游戏，对我个人而言，我真不觉得有什么不好玩的，单人我能玩下去，打人机我都打了300+小时也是不知道说啥好。多人就更棒了！而且确实组队人越多越好玩，这也是在大陆的国服没有之后游戏没有以前好玩了，毕竟加速器还有新的账号，成本和心血都在里面，好些人也懒得去搞新号玩了。
我的国际服是17年买的，那时候没有试验模式，PTR只有国际服有，那时候总是想着早点玩到新东西，于是弄了一个，没想到的是后面出了试验模式，就基本用不上了，就偶尔和想打亚服的朋友打打，更没想到的是后面和网易的分家，这个最初只用来玩PTR的号成了现在的主号......
还是希望国服数据能回来，毕竟我的皮肤，我的好友，太多太多的记忆都在那里呢
叨叨这么点，其实就一句话，[spoiler]游戏有没有国服无所谓，毕竟有也是和谐版，但是玩了那么久，我的国服数据不回来我的差评不会改成推荐的，还有我的暗黑三我的炉石[/spoiler]
